seo.meta_title: South Twin Mountain Trail Guide | 1 Routes, Maps & Conditions
seo.meta_description: Plan your South Twin Mountain hike with live conditions, 1 trail maps & parking info. NH 4000-Footer at 4,902 ft.

schema_place.name: South Twin Mountain
schema_place.description: South Twin Mountain is a 4,902 foot peak in New Hampshire offering hiking trails with scenic views.

mainEntity.name: How long does it take to hike South Twin Mountain?

acceptedAnswer.text: Most routes on South Twin Mountain take 5-7 hours round trip. The most popular trail is 10.0 miles with Hard difficulty. Start early, especially on weekends when parking fills quickly.

mainEntity.name: Is South Twin Mountain hard to hike?

acceptedAnswer.text: South Twin Mountain is rated Hard. At 4,902 feet, expect challenging terrain above treeline with potential for rapid weather changes. Proper footwear and preparation are essential.

mainEntity.name: Do I need a permit to hike South Twin Mountain?

acceptedAnswer.text: No hiking permit is required for South Twin Mountain. However, parking fees may apply at trailheads (typically $3-5/day for WMNF or state parks). A WMNF parking pass covers most White Mountain trailheads.

mainEntity.name: What is the best trail to hike South Twin Mountain?

acceptedAnswer.text: The most popular route is the Gale River Trail, offering Scenic route via Galehead Hut to South Twin..

mainEntity.name: When is the best time to hike South Twin Mountain?

acceptedAnswer.text: The best hiking season for South Twin Mountain is late May through October. Summer and fall offer the best conditions, though expect crowds on weekends. Winter hiking requires specialized gear and experience.

page_content.description:
At 4,902 feet, South Twin Mountain ranks among New Hampshire's celebrated 4000-Footers—a collection of 48 peaks that challenge and inspire hikers throughout the Northeast. This hard summit offers a quintessential White Mountain experience.

Popular Routes

The most popular route, **Gale River Trail**, covers 10.0 miles and is rated Hard. Scenic route via Galehead Hut to South Twin.

Peak Bagging

**Extend Your Adventure:** Galehead Mountain lies just 0.9 miles away, making it an excellent addition for ambitious hikers looking to bag multiple summits.

spring.title: Spring Conditions
spring.conditions: Muddy trails, snow above 3000ft until May
spring.tips: Trail closures for mud season (April-May). Check conditions before heading out.

summer.title: Summer Conditions
summer.tips: Start early to avoid afternoon storms and parking issues. Peak crowds on weekends.

fall.title: Fall Conditions
fall.conditions: Peak foliage late Sept, early snow possible in October
fall.tips: Peak foliage brings peak crowds. Weekday hikes recommended. Watch for ice above treeline in late October.

winter.title: Winter Conditions
winter.conditions: Full winter conditions, extreme cold and wind above treeline
winter.tips: Winter hiking requires specialized skills and gear. Never hike alone. Check avalanche conditions for steeper terrain.

current_hazards: ⚠️ ALPINE ZONE: Weather changes rapidly. Turn back if conditions deteriorate.
Winter conditions in effect - full mountaineering gear required
Hypothermia risk - temperatures 20-40°F colder at summit
Trail markers may be buried under snow
